channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023090498
item.description:
Report X-2023090498

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the B Wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: Four of the twenty-three cans of Rustoleum in fluorescent pink lost their spray caps which allowed for a leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the All-Other Materials Pallet.

item.title: Report X-2023090747
item.description:
Report X-2023090747

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINDED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET, THE RESPONDER DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, RESPONDER DISCOVERED ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A CAP THAT WAS LOOSE BY A FULL TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS A CORRIGATED PARTITION SEPERATING THE INNER CONTAINERS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLE WALLED FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report E-2023090774
item.description:
Report E-2023090774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: FLORISSANT
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver Completed the paper work and veeder root reading. Driver hooked up vapor hose and stuck the tanks. Driver did hook product hose to truck compartment 1st then the ground drop and drop gun to premium drop. Driver completed premium and moved drop gun over to unleaded tank drop and lock down, and it didn't seem to lock in place so he pulled it up and locked it down again. Driver moved the product hose on premium compartment to unleaded compartment. Driver opened external then walked over to box and opened internal. Driver walked over toward the curb to pick something up and heard a whistling noise and the product sprayed up out of the well and driver ran over to close valves

item.title: Report X-2023090330
item.description:
Report X-2023090330

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON OUR LOADING DOCK BETWEEN THE BELTS LEAKING. THE ADMIN PLACED THE HAZMAT INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE. HE ALSO USED NEUTRALIZER ON THE LIQUID THAT SPILLED OUT AND ONTO THE FLOOR. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINED A 2.5L GLASS JUG OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID THAT WAS FOUND BROKEN INSIDE THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: it was found in damage area around 1130 at night when I was doing my walk through. DescribePack: the box was wet, and the cap was loose, so I guess it just leaked. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: got into proper contained wrapped up, with spill pads and a lid.

item.title: Report E-2023090691
item.description:
Report E-2023090691

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: HERCULANEUM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver completed paper work on the QT app. Driver did do the math to make sure the load would fit. Driver stuck the tanks. Driver put cones out. Driver installed drop guns and hoses. Drop gun fitting wiggled side to side then popped up. Driver stopped flow and barricaded product so it wouldn't run down hill.
